title: SDSC SHAR: Overview
content: Satish Dhawan Space Centre SHAR (SDSC SHAR), Sriharikota, is the spaceport of India and a key ISRO facility.
It supports national and international missions for remote sensing, communication, and scientific applications.
Previously known as Sriharikota Range (SHAR), it was renamed in 2002 in memory of Prof. Satish Dhawan.

title: SDSC SHAR: Origin & History
content: In the 1960s, Dr. Vikram Sarabhai envisioned a launch site to advance India's space capabilities.
Sriharikota was selected for its favorable azimuth corridor and proximity to the equator.
The site became operational in 1971 with the launch of the Rohini-125 sounding rocket.

title: SDSC SHAR: Geography & Biodiversity
content: The island is located in the Pulicat backwaters, between Buckingham Canal and the Bay of Bengal.
It is home to eucalyptus, casuarina, coconut, palm, and freshwater ponds with rich biodiversity.
